intro: Xanthisma grindelioides var. grindelioides, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and grayish-green foliage covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by seed heads that resemble dandelion parachutes. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with limited water availability. Xanthisma grindelioides var. grindelioides is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
